dcterms:creator: W. Bialek
I. Nemenman
N. Tishby
dcterms:description: The predictive information (PI) is used as an intrinsic drive to support autonomous, open-ended learning of complex behaviors, capturing how much information the past carries about the future.
dcterms:title: Predictive Information (PI)

dcterms:creator: A. G. Barto
R. S. Sutton
C. W. Anderson
dcterms:description: The cart-pole swing-up experiment is a standard control theory problem used to investigate the effect of the predictive information on episodic reinforcement learning tasks.
dcterms:title: Cart-Pole Swing-Up

dcterms:creator: I. MarkeliÄ‡
K. Zahedi
dcterms:description: The hexapod locomotion experiment aims to learn a locomotion behavior for a hexapod robot, demonstrating the effect of predictive information maximization on a well-structured experimental setting.
dcterms:title: Hexapod Locomotion

dcterms:creator: G. Martius
R. Der
N. Ay
dcterms:description: The hexapod self-rescue experiment combines a high-dimensional morphology with an unsteady environment, where the hexapod must escape from a trap, using predictive information as an intrinsic reward.
dcterms:title: Hexapod Self-Rescue

dcterms:creator: K. Zahedi
A. von Twickel
F. Pasemann
dcterms:description: The YARS simulator is a physical 3D simulator designed for evolving controllers for real robots, providing a platform for testing and developing robotic behaviors.
dcterms:title: YARS Simulator
